title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Business Analysts and Management Consultants

content.rendered:
What are Business Analysts and Management Consultants?

Business Analysts and Management Consultants provide organizations with valuable strategic insights and strategies on how to ensure prime efficiency in the workplace and improve weaker areas of their business. They often possess a business degree and have extensive knowledge on business practices and organizational behavior.

Where do Business Analysts and Management Consultants work?

  • Finance companies
  • Government
  • Freelance

How much do Business Analysts and Management Consultants make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Business Analysts and Management Consultants is $68,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Business Analysts and Management Consultants?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Business majors
  • Finance majors
  • Marketing majors
Search relevant jobs

Business Analyst and Management Consultant skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Business Analysts and Management Consultants succeed in their work:

  • Problem solving skills
  • Good organizational and time management skills
  • Teamwork and leadership skills

What are some common questions about Business Analysts and Management Consultants?

Q: What is it like to be a Business Analyst?

A: Check out real student and alumni feedback about being Business Analysts.
